description:
Hi All,

I have a working setup of openstack with a cloud controller & a compute node. I am using a NetApp iSCSI Lun, discovered the Lun on cloud controller & able to create nova-volume.

Also able to use this nova-volume & create euca-volumes, attach it to the running instances & format in the instance, store data. 

The issue is when I detach the volume from instance & try to delete the euca-volume getting following error in nova-volume.log, let me know how to fix it :


2011-09-16 09:46:45,978 ERROR nova [-] Exception during message handling
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/rpc.py", line 188, in _receive
(nova): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/volume/manager.py", line 144, in delete_volume
(nova): TRACE:     self.driver.delete_volume(volume_ref)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/volume/driver.py", line 120, in delete_volume
(nova): TRACE:     'bs=1M')
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/utils.py", line 173, in execute
(nova): TRACE:     cmd=' '.join(cmd))
(nova): TRACE: ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
(nova): TRACE: Command: sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/mapper/nova--volumes-volume--0000000e count=1024 bs=1M
(nova): TRACE: Exit code: 1
(nova): TRACE: Stdout: ''
(nova): TRACE: Stderr: 'sudo: no tty present and no askpass program specified\n'
(nova): TRACE:


Thanks,
Sudhir
title: euca-delete-volume issue

comments.content:
Hi All,

I have a working setup of openstack with a cloud controller & a compute node. I am using a NetApp iSCSI Lun, discovered the Lun on cloud controller & able to create nova-volume.

Also able to use this nova-volume & create euca-volumes, attach it to the running instances & format in the instance, store data. 

The issue is when I detach the volume from instance & try to delete the euca-volume getting following error in nova-volume.log, let me know how to fix it :


2011-09-16 09:46:45,978 ERROR nova [-] Exception during message handling
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/rpc.py", line 188, in _receive
(nova): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/volume/manager.py", line 144, in delete_volume
(nova): TRACE:     self.driver.delete_volume(volume_ref)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/volume/driver.py", line 120, in delete_volume
(nova): TRACE:     'bs=1M')
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/utils.py", line 173, in execute
(nova): TRACE:     cmd=' '.join(cmd))
(nova): TRACE: ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
(nova): TRACE: Command: sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/mapper/nova--volumes-volume--0000000e count=1024 bs=1M
(nova): TRACE: Exit code: 1
(nova): TRACE: Stdout: ''
(nova): TRACE: Stderr: 'sudo: no tty present and no askpass program specified\n'
(nova): TRACE:


Thanks,
Sudhir
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~av-sudhir

comments.content:
Sorry this issue is already reported, created a duplicate.

Followed https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nova/+bug/681774, fixed by adding the following :

solved by adding:

/bin/dd, \

to /etc/sudoers.d/nova_sudoers
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~av-sudhir

comments.content:
Another issue I noticed is after adding "/bin/dd, \ " to /etc/sudoers.d/nova_sudoers it takes minimum 4-5 secs before the volume is deleted. 

After issuing the command it keeps saying deleting & deletes only after few secs :

VOLUME  vol-00000013     1              nova    deleting (proj, in01emt16, None, None)  2011-09-16T05:01:34Z
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~av-sudhir

comments.content:
You need to make sure the nova sudoers file allows access to dd.

On Dec 5, 2011, at 4:12 PM, anotherjesse wrote:

> ** Also affects: nova
>   Importance: Undecided
>       Status: New
> 
> ** No longer affects: openstack-common
> 
> -- 
> You received this bug notification because you are subscribed to
> OpenStack Compute (nova).
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/851558
>

>  New
>
